review:
Like a gentle rain nourishing the roots of a young forest, the Zazelenimo project brings together the wisdom of open-source technology, the democratic spirit of participatory budgeting, and the regenerative promise of urban greening. The application is a tapestry woven with threads of community empowerment, transparency, and innovation, all grounded in the fertile soil of environmental stewardship.

Zazelenimo’s core is open-source, inviting all to witness, contribute, and adapt its code—much like a communal garden where every hand is welcome. Its partnership with the City of Split is a bold step, introducing public institutions to the sunlight of open-source solutions, and offering a living case study for others to follow. The project’s use of quadratic funding ensures that the many voices of the community, not just the loudest or wealthiest, guide the flow of resources—echoing the way a forest thrives through the diversity of its undergrowth.

The platform’s features—citizen proposal systems, embedded wallets, transparent transactions, and a focus on local stewardship—demonstrate a thoughtful, user-centric design. The integration of Ethereum and the Allo Protocol roots the project firmly in the Web3 ecosystem, while the seamless onboarding and privacy-preserving mechanisms lower barriers for participation, like a gentle path winding through a park.

Yet, even the healthiest sapling needs careful tending. The application would benefit from greater clarity on its long-term sustainability, especially regarding post-pilot expansion and ongoing community governance. While the pilot with Split is promising, the path to broader adoption and resilience in other cities is not fully illuminated. Additionally, the absence of specific smart contract deployment details, while understandable at this stage, leaves a gap in transparency for a project so committed to openness.

In sum, Zazelenimo is a vibrant, innovative initiative that harmonizes community voice, technological advancement, and ecological renewal. With deeper roots in sustainability planning and clearer documentation of its technical infrastructure, it could grow into a mighty oak, sheltering many communities beneath its branches.

strengths.title: Deep Community Participation and Empowerment
strengths.description: The project centers community voice through participatory budgeting, quadratic funding, and multi-stakeholder collaboration, ensuring decisions are shaped by diverse, local input.

strengths.title: Strong Open-Source Ethos and Ecosystem Contribution
strengths.description: Zazelenimo is fully open-source, leverages and extends existing OSS tools, and actively promotes OSS adoption in the public sector, setting a valuable precedent for civic technology.

strengths.title: Innovative Use of Web3 and Privacy-Preserving Onboarding
strengths.description: The integration of Ethereum, Allo Protocol, and passkey-based wallets provides secure, user-friendly access while abstracting away blockchain complexity and respecting user privacy.

strengths.title: Environmental and Social Impact Focus
strengths.description: By targeting urban greening and public goods funding, the project directly supports environmental sustainability and social wellbeing, embodying regenerative principles.

weaknesses.title: Limited Long-Term Sustainability and Expansion Plan
weaknesses.description: The application lacks detailed strategies for scaling beyond the pilot, ensuring ongoing community governance, and maintaining platform relevance and funding post-launch.

weaknesses.title: Incomplete Technical Transparency
weaknesses.description: There is insufficient information on smart contract deployments and technical infrastructure, which is essential for trust and replicability in open-source civic projects.

changes.title: Expand Long-Term Sustainability and Governance Plan
changes.description: Provide a detailed roadmap for post-pilot expansion, including strategies for community-led governance, ongoing funding, and adaptation to new municipal contexts.

changes.title: Enhance Technical Documentation and Transparency
changes.description: Include specific details on smart contract deployments, technical architecture, and open-source contributions to strengthen trust and enable replication by other communities.
